message_1: Let p and q be propositional statements with p being true and q being false. Evaluate the truth value of the statement p ^~ q, where "^" denotes the logical operator for AND and "~" denotes the logical operator for NOT.
message_2:
To evaluate the truth value of the statement p ^ ~q, we first need to find the truth value of ~q. Since q is false, the negation of q, which is ~q, will be true.

Now we have p ^ ~q, where p is true and ~q is true. The AND operator (^) is true only when both of its operands are true. Since both p and ~q are true, the statement p ^ ~q is true.
